description: From Latin excruciātus, past participle of excruciō, from ex- +‎ cruciō, from the base of crux (“cross”).

adjectives.description: excruciate (comparative more excruciate, superlative most excruciate)

examples: And here my heart long time excruciateAmongst the leaves I rested all that night.

verbs.description: excruciate (third-person singular simple present excruciates, present participle excruciating, simple past and past participle excruciated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To inflict intense pain or mental distress on (someone); to torture.
